data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهِ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
The word أُولَئِكَ comes from the root ا و ل ا and is associated with the meanings:
The word أَلَا comes from the root ل ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: To suffer loss or diminution, to be deceived/cheated/beguiled/circumvented, to err/go astray/deviate from/miss the right way, to perish or die, make a thing defective or deficient, destroy or cause to perish, remove/alienate/estrange someone, to be treacherous/ignoble/mean, to be unfaithful, ungenerous, small/little/weak (among mankind), refuse invitation from another.
data.sentence: The word الْخَاسِرُونَ comes from the root خ س ر and is associated with the meanings: To suffer loss or diminution, to be deceived/cheated/beguiled/circumvented, to err/go astray/deviate from/miss the right way, to perish or die, make a thing defective or deficient, destroy or cause to perish, remove/alienate/estrange someone, to be treacherous/ignoble/mean, to be unfaithful, ungenerous, small/little/weak (among mankind), refuse invitation from another.
The word حِزْبَ comes from the root ح ز ب and is associated with the meanings: To befall and distress, divide.

data.meanings: to remember/commemorate/recollect, study in order to remember, remind, bear in mind, mindful, mention/tell/relate, magnify/praise, admonish/warn (e.g. dhikra is the 2nd declenation and it is stronger than dhikr), preach, extol, give status.nobility/eminence/honour, fame, good report, cause of good reputation, means of exaltation.Male/man/masculine (dhakar, dual - dhakarain, plural - dhukur).
data.sentence: The word ذِكْرَ comes from the root ذ ك ر and is associated with the meanings: to remember/commemorate/recollect, study in order to remember, remind, bear in mind, mindful, mention/tell/relate, magnify/praise, admonish/warn (e.g. dhikra is the 2nd declenation and it is stronger than dhikr), preach, extol, give status.nobility/eminence/honour, fame, good report, cause of good reputation, means of exaltation.Male/man/masculine (dhakar, dual - dhakarain, plural - dhukur).

data.meanings: (Ha-Alif-Thal) To drive fast, keep with care, gain mastery over, get the better of, prevail over, gain an advantage.
data.sentence: The word اسْتَحْوَذَ comes from the root ح و ذ and is associated with the meanings: (Ha-Alif-Thal) To drive fast, keep with care, gain mastery over, get the better of, prevail over, gain an advantage.
The word فَأَنْسَاهُمْ comes from the root ن س ي and is associated with the meanings: to forsake/forget/neglect, pretend to forget.
The word حِزْبُ comes from the root ح ز ب and is associated with the meanings: To befall and distress, divide.
